text: Kamila Gradus (born 19 March 1967 in Warsaw, Mazowieckie) is a retired Polish marathon runner, who represented her native country at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, Georgia. ==Achievements== *All results regarding marathon, unless stated otherwise {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |6th |2:32:09 |- |rowspan=2|1993 |Nagoya Marathon |Nagoya, Japan |bgcolor=gold|1st |2:27:38 |- |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |9th |2:36:48 |- |1995 |Nagoya Marathon |Nagoya, Japan |bgcolor=gold|1st |2:27:29 |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |-- |DNF |} ==See also== *Polish records in athletics ==References== * * Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Polish female long- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Poland Category:Sportspeople from Warsaw Category:Legia Warsaw athletes
title: Kamila Gradus
